page.title: 04ECOLOGY NEAR POYNTINGTON 1
page.content: Unspoiled{landscapes}of gently rolling uplands (c.100._200m)with a few deepcut valleys.Soil mostly calcareous and dry with much arable farmland. {Climate:}mild winters(Jan. aver.4_5 deg C) fairly warm summers(July aver.15_16 deg C); 7_8 months growing season; moderately high rainfall (30"_40"yearly); snow rarely lies more than a few days. {Conservation:}The Wincanton Local Plan of May 1985 includes this block within a Special Landscape Area i.e. "it will be safeguarded by carefully controlling all development which could damage its character" e.g. buildings must be in the local stone. The Seven Sisters Wells,source of R.Yeo ,and Waterloo Cresent,will be given Archaeological Protection.
